subtasks: Remove rubbing branches to protect the tree and prevent disease
Thin out competing branches to maintain spacing and promote even growth
Shape the canopy by bending and tying branches to desired angles
Stimulate growth by pruning back long, straggly branches to fruit buds
Maintain proper scaffold structure by selectively removing branches and promoting open-grown habits
Reduce tree height where necessary to maintain safety and access
Ensure proper spacing between main branches for optimal air circulation and light penetration
